commits.comment: Moved the java svn to the new location, https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/webservices/sandesha/trunk/java
Applied the patch from Andrew
Applied the patch from Andrew
Applied patches from Andrew and Thomas.
corrected the build break due to a change in Axis2
Did corrections to the Fault Handling logic. Added a handleFault method to the InOrderInvoker. Applied the patch from Andrew on 'Typos'
Fixed a bug that could cause NullPointerExceptions in the TerminateSequenceProcessor
had forgotten to commit the test classes after a previous refactoring
The patch from Andrew plus some corrections to avaoid test failures.
Added a methods to confugire the created ConfigContext as needed
Removed Author Tags according to Axis2 convensions. Added some missing javadocs and licence declarations.
Corrections to the maven files. Added some dependencies neede by MTOM.
Cleaned some of the test cases.
Deprecated some unused methods of bean managers.
Applied the patch from Matt on Unreliable Messages
Fixed the error pointed by Damitha
Added a test case to show RM working with MTOM
Applied the patch from Thomas on i18n.
Fixed a bug in the AcknowledgementManager which cased the non-inorder case to fail. Added a new test case MTOMRMTest.
a change to include the resource.properties in the mar file
Applied the patch from matt on 'typos'
A correction in the resources.properties file. Corrected Terminate Manager to clean the NextMsg Beans.
Copied the resources.properties file to the jar file.
Made getIncomingSequenceReport method public as Thomas had suggested.
Iproved the AddressableEchoTest to do tests on the IncomingSequenceReports
Matts patch for the Secure RM scenario
Corrected to use commons-logging
Quick fix to a build problem. Need to fill the file with the required content
Updated the test.module.xml
A client to test RM+MTOM message exchange.
Added the MTOMPing operation to the RMSampleService
Corrected the client code to terminate property.
Applied the patch from Matt on refactoring the SequenceAcknowledgement header processing.
Updated the stax API version.
add groupd id
oops remove extra groupid, add scm  url's
change nag email address

Made sender and Invoker thread pools. Still the pool size is 1. (hope to bring this into a policy after some testing). This will allow sandesha2 to send and invoke multiple message concurrently. This also eliminates some deadlock scenarios which existed before.
A correction to the MessageProcessor selection logic. Thanks Thomas for pointing this out.
Corrected to start the client side async listner when client side async control messages are expected.

Changed SequenceManager updateClientListnerIfNeeded method to pick the incomingTransport from the scheme of the To url. This will only be picked if the transportInProtocol is not set. Refactored the Invoker.
Added the WorkerLock class which is used by Invoker and Sender to make sure that two threads of the thread pools are not working on the Same item.
Reduced the waiting time of test cases.
Added a new repo URL and changed the Stax impl. version.
Oops. Had commited hardcoded ports. Reverting...
Applied the patch from Thomas on unreliable messages.
Some changes due to recent refactoring in Axis2.
ImageIO is not available in Axis2 anymore.
Oops. Had missed to remove the imports.

Removed the defaultFactory from the RMModel elements. Removed getElement() method from IOMRMPart. Updated code to go with the latest WSRM1.1 namespaces - Matt's patch Corrected the ackProcessing within SandeshaInHandler to go within a transaction - Andrew's patch
Updated test cases.
Updated module.xml to have the latest WSRM1.1 actions values.
Patch from Matt on security support for the WSRM 1.1 spec.
Removed the 'factory' from the Constructor of some more elements. Added the UsesSequenceSTR from Matts patch.
Updates to test cases.
Added MakeConnection and MessagePending message parts. Added code to initialize MakeConnection and MessagePending messages.
xml files representing MakeConnection and MessagePending messages.
TestCases to test MakeConnection and MessagePending elements.
Changed the package of interop client classes. Added code/config for a interop service.
Added a goal to create an Interop service.
Patch from Andrew.
A bug fix in the sender and invoker.
Changed the RMMsgContext.getMessagePart method to return an IOMMsgPart.

Added a method 'getPropertyKey' to SandeshaUtil which will extract the correct property key from a message context. Used this in Sandesha Handlers. ApplicationMessage processor was modified to set some entries in message context, to be used by other handlers or service impl.
Added a test-case to test weather properties are correctly set in the msgCtx.

Renamed the sequenceId property of the sequencePropertyBean manager to sequencePropertyKey. This reflects its real functionality (since we can use sequenceId/internalSequenceId depending on the RM endpoint).
An update due to a refactoring of the Source.
Updated some MessageProcessors and related classes to use to correct pattern of handling seuuencePropertyKeys. (The correct pattern is to get it from the SandeshaUtil.getSequenceProperty method.)
Moved some more classes to the correct pattern in handling sequence properties.
Changed the methods of the MessageProcessor interface to throw AxisFaults.
Applied the patch from Matt.
Patch from Matt on AckRequest processing.
Removing the old policy processors
Removing old policy context
Adding the new RM Policy Processor
updating the policy defined in the module.xml with the new RMAssertion
Some cleanups with the upgrade to new Neethi2 architecture
Finally test cases are passing with neethi2.
Updated the test cases to comply with the recent changes.
Moved the policy assertion builder to the config directory.
Changed the module.xml to add a policy jar file.
Applied patches from Thomas.
Adding the Rampart based security manager for Sandesha-Rampart integration
Some bug fixes found when implementing polling.
Moved the secure-module creation to its own temp directory.
Updated to match the latest rampart changes

Changed to polling manager to do the polling processing logic using the NextMsgBean manager. This seems to be the correct way since NextMsgBean is the bean item that hs details about an incoming sequence.
A fix in the SandeshaClient to add an Anonymous OutONly operation to a Service Client if one is not present. This will be useful for invocation using stubs.
Added ActionMappings for AckRequested and LastMessage type of messages.
Added the RMInteropService.wsdl the WSDL file for the interop service. Added generated code (ADB) for te Skeleton and Stubs.
Modified the interop:create goal.
Applied the patch from Matt
Updated the default values.
Implemented checkProofOfPossession in RampartBasedSecurityManager
adding a few inline comments and a null check
Added code for interop scenario 4.1 and fixed a few token reference issues in RampartBasedSecurityManager.
Implemented the serialize method in SandesahaPolicyBean.
Removed the UnsupportedOperationException which is thrown in SandeshaPolicyBean.normalize() method.
Added PolicyComponent.equal(PolicyComponent) method to SandeshaPolicyBean
Some bug fixes. These caused failures in different locations - specially in WSRX 1.1.
Updated test cases
Applied the patch from Matt, to update the axis2.xml files.
Did fixes to support secure conversation. Basically there is a new concept of Retransmittable phases.These will be called in every retransmission.
Updated module.xml due to the changes in Axis2.
Updated samples.
Updated interop service and clients.
Got scenario 4.1 workign with the latest axis2 and the latest axiom
Using RampartBasedSecurityManager as the default. RampartBasedSecurityManager - Missing service policy means no security requirement
Getting SecRM scenario working with latest rampart
Getting SecRM scenario working with latest rampart
Improved the waiting time of the AddressableEcho test

Corrected the fault handling logic. Now instead of creating a FaultMessageContext we do it the correct way. I.e. we set nevessary properties (e.g. FaultCode) in the MessageContext and throw an dummy SandeshaException. AxisEngine catches this and sends the fault. Added the code to actually terminate a sequence of a WSRM 1.1 sequence to the TerminateSequenceResponseMsgProcessor.

Added code prevent two SequenceAcknowledgements going for the same sequence in the same message. Moved Ack sending logic from AckManager to the Application message processor which seems to be the better place for it. A bug fix in the SequenceAcknowledgement.
Corrected the termination logic. A bug fix in the RMPolicyProcessor.
Updating SecRm policy
Adding the axis2.xml for the client side listener of the sec-rm case
Use correct callback handler class
Changed the groupId of Axis2 jar.

Did changes to use a cloned version of the CreateSequence message as the reference in the RMS side. The original CreateSequence message will get subjected to things like encryption and it may not be possible to use it as a reference. When an incoming sequence is offered, this reference will be used for the RMD side of that as well.
Updated SecRM services.xml
Updated interop services and clients.
Patch from Andrew for Sandesha2-33.
Some corrections to the SequencePropertyKey selection logic.
Patch from Matt on Sandesha2-35. Added the listener stoping method calls to the TestCases to fix test failures.
Changed Sandesha2 to axis2_1.1 branch where most of the events seems to be happening :-)
Applied the patch from Andrew for Sandesha2-34.
A correction to the MakeConnection action value.

Added an Endpoint part to the SequenceOffer. This is required by the WSRM 1.1 specification. Corrected the AcksTo part to enclose an EndpointReference element. A correction to the MakeConnection action value. Several other bug fixes
Updated the test cases.
Updated interop files
Hd forgotten to add the Endpoint class :(
Sorry guys, this wasn't meant to be committed.
Changing things back to trunk with some other corrections. Sorry abt the delay guys.
Applied the patch from Matt on Sandesha2-32.
exclude test that really does not do anything...
Patch from Matt on Sandesha2-20
Things extracted from the commit 469421 that was done to the branch.
Applied the operation.patch for Sandesha2-20 from Matt.
Patch from Andrew for Sandesha2-37
Applied the patch from Matt for Sandesha2-38
Applied the patches from Andrew on Sandesha2-39 and Sandesha2-40.
Necessary updates from commit 471576 to the branch.
Patch from Andrew for Sandesha2-41
Things from commit 473920 to the branch.

Changed the default security manager back to DummySecurityManager. Having this as RampartBasedSecurityManager makes Sandesha2 dependent on 'security' jars unnecessarily. Removed some paramaters that are not needed in the default case.
Minor trace and import updates taken from the patch to SANDESHA2-42
Improve tracing of exceptions in SenderWorker
Applying Andy's moretrace3.patch for SANDESHA2-2
Applying Andy's terminate.patch for SANDESHA2-45
Tom's patch for SANDESHA2-43
Minor trace updates to SenderWorker
Andy's patch for SANDESHA2-47
Andy's patch for SANDESHA2-48
Add locking to the in-memory storage manager, see SANDESHA2-49
Fix a bottleneck in the locking, see SANDESHA2-49
Ensure we do not nest transactions within SandeshaClient, see SANDESHA2-47
Ensure we clear the transaction flag when in the SenderWorker
Andy's SequenceProcessorTrace patch from SANDESHA2-2
Andy's deadlockAck patch from SANDESHA2-49
Fix build for a java 1.4 jdk
Applying patch for SANDESHA2-46
Changed the groupId to 'org.apache.sandesha2' according to the convention followed by other projects.
Use WS-A to track response messages instead of saving the message context. See SANDESHA2-51
Andy's patch to ensure each message is only stored once, instead of being stored and then updated. See SANDESHA2-52.
Make sendAckIfNeeded static so SandeshaGlobalInHandler doesn't have to new a SequenceProcessor object to call it
Add trace statements
Tom's patch for SANDESHA2-53, to ensure that we do not assign new messages to closed sequences
A fix to rampart securityManager
Refactor tests to minimise wait times and remove duplicated code, see SANDESHA2-54
Andy's latest deadlock patch for SANDESHA2-49
Another deadlock patch from Andy, for SANDESHA2-49
Adding Toms's patch for SANDESHA2-56
deadlock4.patch from Andy for SANDESHA2-49
deadlock5.patch for SANDESHA2-49
Implement deadlock detection for the in-memory store, see SANDESHA2-49
Andy's patch to store protocol messages for later processing when the sequence is not yet running, see SANDESHA2-58
Applying patch for SANDESHA2-57
Applying close storing patch for SANDESHA2-58
Applying ack request storing patch for SANDESHA2-58
Applying NPE patch for SANDESHA2-59
ack request, close and terminate processing refactor patch for SANDESHA2-58
rmVersion should be accessable to sub classes
Applying Tom's patch for SANDESHA2-60
Takahide Nogayama's patch to ensure that sync responses are handled properly, see SANDESHA2-55
Apply Tom's patch to refactor sender and invoker threads, see SANDESHA2-61
Adding the SandeshaThread see SANDESHA2-61
transaction should be transient, not volitle to avoid serialization
Applying patch for SANDESHA2-49 to ensure outsequence id is always found
Use up-to-date axis2 mars, and ensure the tests use a proper ws-a action
Fix a bug where we store the token for an outbound sequence under the key that the inbound sequence should use
Another update to common up the processing for Sender and Invoker see SANDESHA2-61
If a transaction fails to commit, the exception should be thrown
Fix a timing window in reply sequence termination, add trace to beans, and ensure ack messages know that they are flowing out.
More logic moved to the SandeshaThread, see SANDESHA2-61
Make FaultManager methods throw exceptions when there is an error, not return SandeshaExceptions
Some changes from 1.1 - Refactoring of the StorageManager classes - Change to the module.xml policy prefix.
More changes from 1.1.
Sync 2-way for WSRM 1.1, see SANDESHA2-62
Protect against null sequenceKey for createSequence
Support the RM anon URI template, see SANDESHA2-62.
Enable Sandesha to handle inbound fault messages with RM headers
Remove unused imports and unused code
Don't override the replyToEPR for application messages
Associate the Sandesha transaction with the thread that is running the code instead of the message context
Enable RM to work when no addressing headers are present
Enable rmSpecVersion to be set by a value set in the AxisOperation
Add an internalSequenceId to the SequenceAck message
Move the highestIn properties to the RMDBean
Move the last error properties to the RMSBean
fork junits to stop out of memory errors due to threads not being shutdown
Throw an error if a message is sent to a timed out sequence
Allow client to create a sequence over a sequence that was previously terminated
Fix the testTerminateCreateWithWait to use the correct port
Avoid NPE from null body namespace, and remove unnecessary iterator
Move the lastOutMessage to the RMSBean
Move the lastOutMessage to the RMSBean
Move the highestOut properties to the RMSBean
Move the nextMessageNumber to the RMSBean
Avoid polling for terminated sequences
Ensure we use consistent ws-a spec levels
Move toEPR, replyToEPR, acksToEPR and ServerCompleted messages to RMSequenceBean and RMDBean
Enable ACK Requests for closed sequences
Patch for http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-63
Move clientCompletedMessages and terminate properties to RMSBean and RMSequenceBean
Fix up build dependencies
Wake sender/invoker threads after transaction commits
Sender transaction committed when Sequence times out
Move the OutOfOrderRanges, TermianteReceived, lastActivatedTime, noOutGoingMsgs, transportTo, sequenceClosedClient and lastInMsgId to RMS/RMDBeans
Move OfferedSequence, OfferedEndPoint, SoapVersion and SequenceClosed to RMS/RMDBeans
Move sequenceTimedOut property to RMSBean
Remove InternalSequenceId property
Move rmSpecVersion property to RMSequenceBean
Move securityToken property to RMSequenceBean
Remove allSequences property
Remove SequencePropertyBeanMgr
Add module.xml properties to control MakeConnection support
Simplify config of sync 2-way apps, see SANDESHA2-64
A feature to tell rm bean managers weather or not to include booleans when searching. This will be used in one of my later commits.
Update RMSBean in CreateSequenceResponseProcessor
A correction to set the polling mode to the RMDBean correctly. Corected some mistakes I hd done in the last commit.
Move RM Anon URI rewriting to the Application Message Processor
Add a util method for consistent UNRELIABLE_MESSAGE checking
Remove unnecessary store-and-restore of the message context when polling
Minor improvement to waitUntilSequenceCompleted to stop additional sleep if the sequence is completed
Remove checkForCreateSequenceRefused from FaultManager as it doesn't do anything
Add flags so that we can correctly match primitive types when searching for beans
Generate the secure module, so that it doesn't get out of step with module.xml
http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-65
Support for Anonymous InOut scenario for RM 1.0. Updated the AnonymousEchoTest to verify this. Some refactoring to the Ack processing and creation logic.
Sample client to demonstrate Anonymous InOut scenarios
A bug fix to include the sandesha-policy jar file in the binary distribution.
Fix up a couple of merge errors
Make unit tests pass on XP.  Fix problem uncommitted transaction problem when terminating sequences, removed a few unused imports
Update echo test to remove connection problem
Ensure that a FaultMessage can be created when RM is enabled
Ensure that the SandeshaThread's Context ClassLoader is the same ClassLoader used by the rest of Axis
Offered sequence should have ClientCompletedMessages set
A bug fix to avoid a NPE.
Moved the clone method to SandeshaUtil. Added logic to preserve the 'processed' state of header blocks.
waitForSequenceCompletion using -1 value never waits until the sequence terminates
Remove a few compile warnings and refactor getting of RMS/RMD Beans from Fault/Sequence/AcknowledgementManager
Fix NPE in SandeshaGlobalInHandler where Sequence not found
Search for non-terminated sequences, and set the internal sequence id when possible
Improve error message
Only time out sequences based on SenderBeans that have an internal sequence id set
Stop threads from ending too soon, add in trace, and delete some dead code
Refactor ack processing inside SequenceProcessor
Refactor scenarios tests
Fix for http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-69
Add a new test which runs the main scenarios with unit-test security enabled, and some related bug fixes
Clean up some redundant code
Fix some sync-2-way errors that stopped the backchannel working with WSRM 1.1
NPE in sendAckIfNeeded
Stop deleting RMD beans, until we can implement a proper timeout mechanism
Fix NPE in SandeshaClient.cleanupTerminatedSequence
Add support for the CreateSequenceRefused fault message
Avoid loading and saving message contexts when we get a create sequence response
Update to HttpCore 4.0-alpha3, to match Axis2 change r501869
Add support for generating wsrm:UnknownSequence faults
Ensure we always find the correct namespace for MessagePending headers
Add support for generating InvalidAcknowledgement fault
Refactor sync-2-way with RM 1.0 so that is is treated as a very specific poll
Add missing copyright to the scenarios tests
Add support for generating the MessageRolledOver Fault
Add a config option to use message serialization, see SANDESHA2-70

Fixed a bug in RM 1.0 Anon InOut - Was not adjusting the senderBean for retransmissions. Fixed a bug in InMomorySenderBeanManager.getNextMsgToSend - was not doing the retransmission test Fixed a bug in sender - The workId sould contain the timeToSend, otherwise retransmissions will not happen correctly. Moved some strings to the i18n files.
A new policy to enforce RM at the server side. Corrected the policy handling logic to load service/operation level policies. Removed some commented code.
RangeString doesn't perform for long running sequences, Add a test for MessageRolloverFaults and add method to RMSampleService.java to stop MethodNotFound exceptions
Update code to generate wsrm:SequenceClosed Faults
Update code to generate wsrm:SequenceTerminated Faults
Move to new WSDL constants, to match upstream Axis2 changes
Make the PollingManager more similar to the other worker threads
Make the Sender take each sequence in turn, to avoid starving them
A testcase was failing without this dependancy.
Add better error reporting when failing to send a TerminateResponse, add the logging to RMDBean for ServerCompletedMsgs
Remove as much as possible from the global in handler, and delete dead code
Updated mtom_service.xml files.
This dependancy was not needed after updating the mtom_service.xml files.
Removed unused messages
Match rm spec defined fault reason strings
Move some build deps up to match the axis2 levels
Fix a build break, caused by upstream Axis2 changes
When receiving a CreateSequenceRefused Fault Sandesha2 should terminate the outbound sequence and notify any waiting clients of the problem
Copy the CONTENT_TYPE over to the sync response message context, to fix the SOAP 1.2 tests
Resolve NPE when looking for SenderBean and not finding it
Fix compile errors caused by upstream Axis2 changes to the OperationContext constructors
changed AckRequest, LastMessage and TerminateSequence ActionMappings to the RMInOutOperation. Having them as InOnly caused the response to come with 202 in the Servlet case.
Handle exceptions generated when generating a fault message inside the InvokerWorker
Clean up setting the acksTo for sequences, and move inbound sequence info onto the operation context
wsrm:UnknownSequence should be wsrm:Identifier for fault message
Set flags correctly on RMSBean to prevent early termination of sequences
Improve performance of MakeConnection by polling less often, and paying attention to MessagePending headers
Protect against Null to address in SenderWorker, add extra trace information in SandeshaThread and InMemorySenderBeanMgr
Move to new WS-RM and WS-MC namespaces, to match the latest WX-RX spec
Notify waiting clients that a sequence has timed out
Remove deadlock between Invoker and InvokerWorker over InvokerBeans and RMDBeans.  Removed the invoked flag from the InvokerBean as it isn't used.
Ensure protection against null headers (support axiom change to avoid serialization of empty SOAP headers)
Create a SOAPHeader if one doesn't exist when piggy backing acks
Modify SequenceProcessor so that ACKS are sent to non anonymous acks-to addresses when processing a duplicate message
Remove ListenerManager code as it isn't required

Fix duplicate RMSBean error from SenderWorker which is caused when 2 sends happen at the same time targetting the same end point, which causes 2 RMSBeans to be created by the setupNewClientSequence which have the same InternalSequenceId, also reworked some trace from MakeConnectionProcessor
Reduce the number of RMDBean lookups, and pass where found already.  Make the getting of the SandeshaPolicyBean consistent.
Add a MessageId to the CreateSequenceResponse message (fixes AddressingVersionTest failure)
Put the uuid associated with an anonymous endpoint into the RMSBean, instead of on the Service Context
Ensure that we always signal a transport, if one is waiting as we send a message
Rework acks so that we piggyback based on the To EPR, and avoid storing ack messages when we know that we can piggyback later
Check for sequences timed out on the Sender rather than when a message arrives, Delete terminated RMS/RMDBeans after a configurable period, Terminate RMDBeans after the Inactivity timeout is reached

Made the property copying logic (from referenceMessage to newMessage) generic. Properties to be copied can be specified in the module.xml within the "propertiesToCopyFromReferenceMessage" property. If it is in the key1:key2 format, the property with the key 'key1' will be copied with the key 'key2'.
Increased the time interval to avoid test failures.
Move propertiesToCopyFromReferenceMessage in module.xml as it was stopping policy info from being loaded.  Also fix several NullPointerExceptions in Sender and PollingManager
Enable duplicate messages to be processed by Reliable messaging.  Duplicate message is detected by the SandeshaGlobalInHandler, then processed by the SequenceProcessor.processReliableMessage
Switch test xml files to soap 1.1 to work around a unit test failure
Use WS-RM anonymous address to piggyback ack messages
Minor tweak to duplicate processing to enable message to reach the RMMessageReceiver so ACK messages can be sent.
Ensure that we match up inbound and outbound sequences, so that we stop polling once we get the reply messages that we expect
Put some more diagnostics into the test case
Move the StorageMap off the context, and into the storage manager
Make the SandeshaInHandler a no-op when RM is not enabled
Fix typo in constant
Ensure we try the backchannel before we allow a message to be returned by MakeConnection
MustUnderstands that have been processed are lost after message serialized/deserialized
For AckRequested, SequenceFault and MessagePending headers, set them as processed when fromOMElement is called
Use the HOLD_RESPONSE property to hold the transport for sync 2-way messages
Only remove sequences which have a set sequenceRemoveTimeout value
Mark the RMSBean as terminated if a SequenceUnknown or SequenceTerminated fault is returned from the RMD
Move fixed RM state off the context objects and onto the axis configuration
Stop trace from being turned on in the unit tests
Set the Sequence Identifier when processing SequenceTerminated or SequenceUnknown faults
Make the SandeshaUtil.getPermanentStorageManager use the correct classname
SANDESHA2-75: Automatically send an offer when using WSRM 1.0 and connecting to a service that contains OUT-IN meps.
Update to match Axis2 transport description changes

Avioded rewriting of the Addressing anonymous URI for WSRM 1.0 messages. Avoided standalone acks in the WSRM 1.0 anonyous InOut scneario. If such an ack get returned the client may assume the message to be InOnly and avoid from replaying request msgs to get the response.
Moved the TerminateSequence action mapping to the InOnly group. Added a ServiceClient.setPolicyBean method. Using this users can set their policy beans through the client API.
Make sure that the right namespace is used to parse Subcodes from SequenceFaults
Exceptions caught when processing SenderWorker.checkForSyncResponses should log a warning and not throw the exception otherwise Terminate processing does not complete for RM1.0
Axiom changes have caused exceptions when generating fault RM messags, this fix stops the unit test failures
SandeshaClient close/terminate/ack request may be sent using a different soap version to the rest of the sequence messages if the Options instance doesn't contain a soap version uri.
See sandesha-77
Use the Sandesha2Constant for the RMDuplicate operation.  This fixes a problem where acks are not sent for duplicate messages.
Fix Build issue where AxisFault constructors have changed and makeFault method added.  Changed the jakarta.httpcore.version to alpha4 to match axis2 and resolve ClassNotFound issues
See http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-83
Only piggyback ACKs if the sequence has an ACK to piggyback.  Check that an ACK is valid for a sequence.  Remove a few unused imports from the MTOM test
SenderBean not locked when updating the next retransmission time.  InMemorySenderBeanMgr can return a SenderBean which is not eligible for sending
See http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-84
Commit transaction after processing each part of the message inside the SandeshaInHandler.  This fixes both a deadlock with the SenderWorker with ordering of RMS/RMDBeans
Check for AxisOperation in SandeshaModule.engageNotify as well as AxisService when deciding if it is an out in operation for RM Auto offering
Enable the CSR Fault test.  Move the RM Fault processing to the SandeshaGlobalInHandler which fixes the action not found error for RM1.0 Fault messages
See http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-85
Improved the target resolver to set "USE_ASYNC" to false when Sandesha2 is not engaged.
A bug fix
Updated the axis2.xml files
Added the dependancy commons-fileupload. Some changes to dependency versions.
Corrected the SandeshaClient.terminateSequence method. 	- This was not sending an ampty LastMessage in the WSRM 1.0 case, but this is wrong according to the protocol. Several other bug fixes.

Some changes to the RMScenarioTest - Omited the checking of the termination of the response message in WSRM 1.0 sync InOut case. Since we terminate with the SandeshaClient.terminateSequence method, we send the Empty Body Last Message but still the server has not corrected to respond with a LastMessage.
Sorry, that was a mistake :-)
Folder structure for the maven2 build

patch for - Sandesha2 86
More changes for Sandesha2 86
Updated pom.xml
More changes for the maven2 build - Added the interop module
More corrections from Sumedha
patch from sumedha - Sandesha2 86
Fixed test cases.
Optimized the maven scripts
See http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SANDESHA2-87
Updated the pom files
Avoid deadlock between Invoker and InvokerWorker when dealing with a 2-way message.  Deadlock is caused by RMDBean and InvokerBean taken in different orders.
Skip Sandesha processing if RM is not enabled for a Service.
Fixed test cases - to work from within IDEs
git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/webservices/sandesha/trunk/java@532708 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
Correct mar processing so properties files are added to the Sandesha mar
A correction to the mar target, resource files were not being coppied correctly.
Changed the name of the artifact from the core module to 'sandesha2-core'
Some updates to the pom.xml
Updates to the maven files
Applied sumedhas patch on distributions
Make a CreateSequenceRefused fault if RM is not enabled for a particular service and it receives a CreateSequence message

Added the samples and test modules to the maven2 build. Repo creation and sample creation scripts were written in seperate Ant files which get called from the pom.xml file. Moved the test and sample; src,resources files to the correct locations. Maven1 build was corrected according to these changes.
Corrected dependencies. Moved some resources files to correct places. Some other corrections.
Corrected the path for Policy resources
Sumedha's patch - distri. version2
Updates to TestCases
Both src and bin distributions should be created
Commented the WSRM 1.0 syncEcho test- this hs a Random failure - fixing...
Made sandesha2 dependent on Axis2 1.2.
Solve access control exceptions when j2 security is on
git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/webservices/sandesha/trunk/java@536476 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
Fix a couple of deadlocks.  One between Sender and SenderWorker with ordering of RMS and RMDBeans, the other fixes a problem with InvokerWorker and SenderWorker and ordering of RMS and RMDBeans.
Commit the transaction when the SenderWorker detects an un-sendable message
PAtch from Sumedha - dependancy removal patch
cloneMessageContext String.getBytes should use UTF8 as the default encoding

when the client sends an LastMessage control message, the server also should try to coplete the response sequence with a LastMessage. LastMessage was marked as InOut in the module.xml. LastMessageProcessor was added. Corrected the AXIOM version (to 1.2.4)
removed commented dependancies
Abort processing for RM faults once processed
A bug fix - to support SMTP transport

Ignore the anonOutIn operation when deciding if we should offer a sequence. If we don't ignore this operation then we actually send an offer for all services, which fails to interoperate with some one-way services.
Return a fault if 2-way RM 1.1 is attempted without MakeConnection
Ensure we stop polling when a combination of sync and async 2-way calls are performed
Ensure orphaned messages obtain RM namespace correctly
Changed the SenderWorker.checkForsyncResponse to accept an response MsgContext if one is alread available. A bug fix in the MsgInitializer
Piggyback acks on Terminate messages, to help end sequences cleanly.

Allow finer transactional control to stop window where acks are sent before transactions commit.  This reduces the time the transactions hold onto locks.  Finally improve the transaction commit/rollback handling when exceptions are thrown
Put a delay into SenderBeans returned by the MakeConnectionProcessor.  This stops duplicates being sent along MakeConnections that arrive at short intervals
When a SenderBean isn't found inside SenderWorker.updateMessage stop sending the message
Release the transport if it is blocked too long. This frees up transport resources when doing sync-2-way messaging with RM.
Delete the create sequence message once the sequence is up and running.
A fix for a possible NullPointer
Create a plug point to allow application context to be moved onto the InvokerWorker threads.

ensure we do not send makeConnection msgs aggresively

The fix is a logic change in sandesha to stop two way sandeshaOps being seen as user defined ops.  This in turn stops sandesha from sending offers for one way user defined ops.

InvalidAck err sent to wrong location.  It is currently sent to itself and not to the other end.

when handling duplicate messages. i.e if the services blocks the thread for 60 seconds, then there is a possiblity that RMS sends duplicate messages. these duplcate messages are locked in the GloblaInHander util first message clear the service. Then when after processing these messages they going to commit. At this commit release locks method throws a Runtime Exception which causes a soap fault message. this can be avoided by catching this exception at this level. But how ever there may be an error with the InMemory Transaction model.
Solve IllegalMonitorStateException problem as reported by Amila by only adding the bean to the list of locked beans if it really did get the lock.
removing transport headers if the transport is mail
remove the hard coded timout value
should get the message type using the response message context. this gives an excpetion when using with security.

Fixes made to improve compliance with spec's and interop with other implementations: - AckRequest's now added as piggybacks to application msgs (this is needed as implementations don't have to piggyback acks and therefore could only respond to ackRequest msgs.) - We can ignore piggybacked ack requests as Sandesha piggyback acks at every opportunity - Offered EP's can't be set to none so have set to use AcksTo as the offered EP if one hasn't been set - Updated so that we poll for terminateSeqResponse - Updated so that we offer for 1.1 as well as 1.0.  This fixes an interop issue with WCF.

Fix to allow automatic reallocation of sequences that have timed out or been deleted.  The solution is to have a reallocated RMSBean point at the RMSBean created as part of the reallocation via a new RMSBean attribute that contains the internalSeqID of the newly created RMSBean.
reformat the code

Set a property for make connections and terminate response messages to send 202 accepted header for synapse nhttp transport. Also increas the terminate message delay time suite for nhttp transport as well
increase the terminate message delay inorder to work this properly with synapse nhttp

- Fix newly added reallocation code as deadlock had been introduced. - Changed RMSBean to store EndpointReference for offered Endpoints so ref params don't get lost - Update so that all backchannel msgs on MC's are processed successfully - Commented out sending of AckRequested msgs as not needed as yet and impacts performance
applied the patch for SANDESHA2-191

- Msgs are being lost because RMDBeans are being updated to say msgs have been received before complete insertion of InvokerBeans.  The fix is to make the updating and insertion complete under one transaction. - The sync1way reallocation code isn't triggered because the client doesn't receive any faults from the server.  The fix is to set the faultTo so wsa has somewhere to send the fault.
Fix committed for JIRA SANDESHA2-192.  Thanks Rick.

- When an inorder RM system is under load msgs aren't always being delivered to applications as the InvokerWorker currently working the seq has the lock on the seq but has decided that there are no more msgs to process as the SequenceProcessor thread hasn't quite got as far as inserting a new InvokerBean.  This means neither thread does the work of delivering the msg to the application.  The fix is to move the removing of the lock on the sequence to before we commit the tran used to find the InvokerBean in the InvokerWorker.
Added reallocated field to match method in RMSBean.  Thanks Francois Mireaux for pointing this out.

The matching of the primitive type reallocated field happened whether or not the field had been set in the matcher RMSBean.  I've changed it so that it only matches upon request i.e. the field is set in the matcher bean.
Fix committed for JIRA SANDESHA2-196.  Thanks Rick
setting the rms annonymous address to close sequence as well

return the thread always if it is getting the response at the client side. there was a bug not returing 202 Accepted for response messages for dual channel case

Fix added so that duplicate Seq ID's won't get added to either inmemory or permanent stores.

Fix to Sandesha as problem highlighted after move to recent Axis2 release.  The thread ABORT logic has changed slightly in Axis2 so was causing NPE's when an RM inorder response was being delivered to a client.  The fix is to use a thread SUSPEND for inorder Sync responses.
Further update related to the last fix.  A null check was added as Sync RM 1.0 msgCtx's may not have a to address.

Removed copying of TRANSPORT_HEADERS property from referenced MsgCtx into newly created MsgCtx as relies on specific information being available in future layers.
Update POM to point at new plugin maven repo.
Use org.apache:apache:7 as parent POM, so that the build has access to the new Apache snapshot repository. This also makes sure that all artifacts include the appropriate LICENSE and NOTICE files.
Fixed the transport dependencies so that Sandesha can be compiled again.
Let the Sandesha integration tests use the WSS4J version selected by Rampart. Note that the SNAPSHOT version currently referenced in the POM is over 18 months old.

Removed dependency on axis2-transport-tcp. The TCP transport is never used in the tests.

SANDESHA2-203 Contributor:Rick Slade Committer:Rich Scheuerle Summary: Adjustments to the resource.properties file. Some messages are removed. Other messages are fixed.
Set up svn:ignore for Eclipse.
Fixed typo in unit test name.
PiggyBacked acks sent on closeSeq & terminateSeq with mustUnderstand set to true breaks RSP spec.  Fixed so that all piggybacked acks are sent with mustUnderstand set to false.
Updated Axiom version to 1.2.11-SNAPSHOT because 1.2.10-SNAPSHOT is no longer available.
Moved the XDoc documents and related files to the places expected by Maven 2 and did the minimal fixes to make mvn site succeed (i.e. basically made the XML files well formed).
Restore the site logos.
SAND-14: Reintegrated the change done in r729209 by gdaniels back into the site sources. PLEASE DO NOT MODIFY A GENERATED SITE WITHOUT ALSO UPDATING THE SITE SOURCES.

Reintegrated the changes done in r545826 and r582763 (download entries for 1.2 and 1.3) by chamikara and sumedha back into the site sources. PLEASE DO NOT MODIFY A GENERATED SITE WITHOUT ALSO UPDATING THE SITE SOURCES!
Fixed formatting of POM files (which had inconsistent indentation and a mix of tabs and spaces).
Adding missing relativePath (because the default value ../pom.xml is not correct here).

Removed unnecessary configurations of the maven-compiler-plugin. The correct Java version is already set in the root/parent POM and in the mar module, the configuration is useless because there are no sources.
Centralized the management of the Rampart version in the root POM.
Use ${project.version} to refer to the Sandesha2 version (as recommended by Maven 3), and eliminated usage of ${sandesha2.version}, ${pom.version}, ${version} and harcoded version.

Use maven-shade-plugin to produce the sandesha2-client-constants JAR. This has the advantage that the resulting Maven artifact no longer has a dependency on sandesha2-core (from which sandesha2-client-constants is extracted). This is because maven-shade-plugin produces a dependency reduced JAR.
Skip site generation in submodules. We only need to generate the site of the root project.
Produce and show a consistent set of project reports in the Maven site.
Updated the POM metadata (URLs, mailing lists, SVN, etc.).
Replaced tabs by spaces.

Use a dependencySet instead of a fileSet to include the JARs and the MAR into the binary distribution. Copying stuff from the target folder of sibling projects is a bad practice. Adding the other Maven modules as dependencies also eliminates the Javadoc warnings about missing packages.
Replaced tabs with spaces.

Again include the architecture and user guides (which were moved to make it possible to generate the Maven site) into the docs distribution. Also upgraded the maven-assembly-plugin because 2.1 has an issue with file permissions in ZIP files.
Removed the axis2-codegen dependency from the root POM. It is only used by the interop module, which already has a dependency declaration for axis2-codegen.
Removed the direct StAX, activation and javamail dependencies and use whatever Axis2 and Axiom recommends. In particular this removes the duplicate dependency on the StAX API.
Use Maven 2 style variable substitution for readme and release notes files.
Removed unnecessary repositories.
Enabled Javadoc generation for the Maven site.
Prevent the apache-release profile from generating a source JAR for sandesha2-client-constants (because it would be empty).
Skip the default source release assembly configured in org.apache:apache because we have our own source distribution.
Use the maven-javadoc-plugin version configured in org.apache:apache (2.5) because 2.7 does some weird things when building the module Javadocs.
Also use the shade plugin to produce the sandesha2-policy artifact.
Removed old Maven 1 stuff.
Fixed some outdated links and mailing list addresses.
Removed unnecessary or incorrect sourceDirectory, testSourceDirectory and resource entries in POM files.
Added maven-release-plugin configuration.
Some formatting changes in POM files to avoid spurious changes introduced by the maven-release-plugin.
Use maven-javadoc-plugin instead of Ant to generate the Javadoc for inclusion in the doc distribution.
Configured the RAT plugin and added missing license headers.
Avoid creating log files in source directories.
Set svn:ignore.
Added missing plugin version.
Updated distributionManagement.
[maven-release-plugin] prepare branch 1_4
Rolling back failed attempt to create release branch (caused by MRELEASE-446).
[maven-release-plugin] prepare branch 1_4
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release 1_4
Make sure that if useSeparateListener=true and the response code is 200, the transport is cleaned up properly to avoid connection pool starvation.
Don't deploy the distributions to the Maven repository. Users should download them from the mirrors.
Sandesha2 1.2 has already been archived.
Added missing NOTICE.txt file to the distributions.
Converted index.xml to a real XDoc document.
Implemented Apache Project Branding Requirements.
Skip deployment of artifacts for the sandesha2-tests module.
Make sure that the right NOTICE file is included in Maven artifacts.
Disambiguate the release dates in the download page.
Added an entry for 1.4 to the download page.
Avoid IOExceptions when sandesha2-tests is executed in a multi-module build.
Let Maven generate checksums when installing the distributions into the local repository.
Fixed a mistake in the 1.4 download entry. This release will be compatible with Axis2 1.5.4.
Removed incorrect or redundant sourceDirectory and testSourceDirectory. This should fix the problem that the unit test classes are included in the Javadoc published with the site.
Make sure that the information about the latest release in the download page is updated automatically.
Removed duplicate copyright footer.
Updated the link to the KEYS file.
Make sure that we use the expected Axis2 version, even for transitive dependencies of Rampart.
Use dependencyManagement for all Axis2 and Axiom dependencies. This gives us better control over the stuff downloaded by Maven when resolving transitive dependencies.
Set svn:ignore.
Fixed an issue in the Sandesha2 DOAP file.
Fixed a build failure caused by the change described in AXIS2-4196.
Updated Axiom snapshot version.
Added entry for 1.4 to the DOAP file.
Temporary fix to the neethi trunk changes which caused a compilation failure and switch back to the neethi trunk ASA the compatibility issues are fixed
[maven-release-plugin] prepare branch 1_6
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release 1_6
Updated the dependency versions of the trunk.

Created an assertion builder for each individual assertion used by Sandesha. This way of parsing the RMAssertion is much more lengthy, but integrates better with Neethi. If this had been done from the start, then it would have been much easier to upgrade to Neethi 3.0.0-SNAPSHOT.
Updated Axis2 version.
Applied a workaround for MASSEMBLY-422 / MASSEMBLY-449. This should fix the broken file and directory permissions in the distribution ZIP files.
Changed Neethi version to current trunk. 3.0.0-SNAPSHOT is no longer available.
Preparing to archive the 1.3 release.
Updated for 1.6.0 release.
Pushing back the changes done in r1130464 to the trunk to avoid loosing them in the next major release.
Updated Axiom version.

Removed the explicit dependency on Neethi and instead rely on the transitive dependency from Axis2, so that we no longer need to keep the Neethi version number (and exclusion rules) in sync with Axis2.
Removed some unnecessary direct dependencies.
Applied patch for SANDESHA2-209.
Fixed SANDESHA2-210.
Fixed SANDESHA2-114.
Eliminated a couple of illegal direct references to Axiom implementation classes.
Fixed incorrect Axiom iterator usage.
* Use the new OMXMLBuilderFactory API. * Avoid FileReader because it uses the platform default encoding and that may cause issues if it is not UTF-8.
* Fault code should also be a QName. * Some code simplifications using features available in Axiom.
Fixed some variable names.
Don't attempt to create fault subcodes with SOAP 1.1.
* Added entry for the 1.6.1 release. * Some formatting improvements.
Fixed the incorrect project name in the DOAP file.
Added an entry for the Sandesha2 1.6.1 release.
Fixed a couple of incorrect release dates.
Allow Sandesha2 builds to run concurrently.
Make TestCallback thread safe.
Updated maven-surefire-plugin to version 2.11 so that it recognizes the skipTests option.
Put each async echo scenario in a different test case to make it easier to analyze the sporadic test failure we are seeing in the Jenkins builds.
Applied the patch for SANDESHA2-211.
Switched the Sandesha2 trunk to Axiom 1.2.14-SNAPSHOT.
Eliminated a couple of references to deprecated classes so that we don't need to add a dependency to axiom-compat.
Setting uniqueVersion=true to prevent the Synapse build from downloading the wrong version.
Updated site for 1.6.2 release.
Fixed SANDESHA2-212.
Updated site for 1.6.2 release.
Updated DOAP file for 1.6.2 release.
Eliminated reference to deprecated Axiom API.
Eliminated a dependency on the bug described in AXIOM-422; the children of a SOAPHeaderBlock should be plain OMElements, not SOAPHeaderBlocks.
AXIS2-5315 - Removed Callback usage from Sandesha2
Changes required for AXIS2-5340.
Changes introduced by AXIS2-5315 in r1349635 [1]
AXIS2-5315 - Changes according to R1350570.
Don't allow repositories other than Maven central (except for snapshots).
Added TM to the Sandesha logo.
Moved to new Axiom snapshot version.
Setting correct svn:eol-style.
Some code simplifications.
Fixed download page: 1.6.1 was correctly marked as archived, but the links were pointing to the mirrors.
Configuring the project to use maven-scm-publish-plugin.
Create SOAPFaultText only for SOAP 1.2.
Create SOAPFaultText only for SOAP 1.2.
